001.comments: Perhaps the most fundamental concept of political philosophy is "authority." In the process of pursuing this central topic, we will also consider a number of related issues, including social contract theory, democratic theory, anarchism, liberalism, and justice. Readings will include classic and contemporary sources. We will also consider real life exercises (and abuses) of authority, along with some empirical studies, as sources of philosophical questions and to illustrate philosophical points.COVID-19 notice: during 2020W Term 1, this course (lectures and discussions) will be taught entirely online and asynchronously (with some synchronous options).

description: Theories of political and legal obligation and authority, legal reasoning, society and the state. Readings in classic and contemporary texts.
